description: Scotch heather (Calluna vulgaris) is an amazing plant species with its striking purple-pink hues, and green foliage. Perfect for the rock and alpine gardens, Scotch heather can thrive in full sun or partial shade and can tolerate a wide variety of pH levels, from acid to alkaline soils. Its evergreen foliage is a great contrast to its bell-shaped blossoms, providing interest throughout all four seasons and an easy way to brighten up any landscape. Its prolific flowering also makes it a great food source for bees, butterflies, and other beneficial insects. Super hardy and low maintenance, Scotch heather makes a great impact in any garden.
